body_html:
@chris-smith-zocdoc it is something peculiar to CentOS 7 or the Python dot-dot version therein.

This Dockerfile:

FROM ubuntu:16.04

RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
        ca-certificates \
        curl \
        python \
        && \
    apt-get clean && \
    rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

RUN curl -O https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py && \
    python get-pip.py && \
    rm get-pip.py

RUN pip install 'tensorflow == 1.4.0'

CMD sleep infinity

when built and run (attaching a bash shell, running Python:

Python 2.7.12 (default, Nov 20 2017, 18:23:56) 
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609] on linux2

) works fine stat'ing the s3 file you cite, where as this Dockerfile

FROM centos:7

RUN yum -y update && \
    yum -y install \
        ca-certificates \
        curl \
        python

RUN curl -O https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py && \
    python get-pip.py && \
    rm get-pip.py

RUN pip install 'tensorflow == 1.4.0'

CMD sleep infinity

when built and run (attaching a bash shell, running Python:

Python 2.7.5 (default, Aug  4 2017, 00:39:18) 
[GCC 4.8.5 20150623 (Red Hat 4.8.5-16)] on linux2

) produces the error you cite.

body:
@chris-smith-zocdoc it is something peculiar to CentOS 7 or the Python dot-dot version therein.

This Dockerfile:
```Dockerfile
FROM ubuntu:16.04

RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
        ca-certificates \
        curl \
        python \
        && \
    apt-get clean && \
    rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

RUN curl -O https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py && \
    python get-pip.py && \
    rm get-pip.py

RUN pip install 'tensorflow == 1.4.0'

CMD sleep infinity
```
when built and run (attaching a bash shell, running Python:
```
Python 2.7.12 (default, Nov 20 2017, 18:23:56) 
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609] on linux2
```
) works fine stat'ing the s3 file you cite, where as this Dockerfile
```Dockerfile
FROM centos:7

RUN yum -y update && \
    yum -y install \
        ca-certificates \
        curl \
        python

RUN curl -O https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py && \
    python get-pip.py && \
    rm get-pip.py

RUN pip install 'tensorflow == 1.4.0'

CMD sleep infinity
```
when built and run (attaching a bash shell, running Python:
```
Python 2.7.5 (default, Aug  4 2017, 00:39:18) 
[GCC 4.8.5 20150623 (Red Hat 4.8.5-16)] on linux2
```
) produces the error you cite.
